citation.article-title: Puniceicoccus vermicola gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel marine bacterium, and description of Puniceicoccaceae fam. nov., Puniceicoccales ord. nov., Opitutaceae fam. nov., Opitutales ord. nov. and Opitutae classis nov. in the phylum 'Verrucomicrobia'
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Opitutae (O.pi.tu′tae. N.L. fem. pl. n. Opitutales type order of the class; -ae ending to denote a class; N.L. fem. pl. n. Opitutae the class of the order Opitutales).

Equivalent to subdivision 4 (Hugenholtz et al., 1998) of the phylum ‘Verrucomicrobia’ and is defined by phylogenetic analyses based on 16S rRNA gene sequences obtained from four cultured representatives and a wide range of uncultured bacteria retrieved mainly from marine and soil habitats.
The class comprises the order Opitutales and the order Puniceicoccales.
The type order is the order Opitutales.
